snippet: Gunfire and explosions were heard in the capital a day after a general announced a takeover, but it was not clear who was in control of the central African country.
abstract: Burundi Pres Pierre Nkurunziza returns to country after failed coup attempt; calls on citizens to remain calm, saying situation is under control and constitutional order is being maintained.

byline.original: By ISMA'IL KUSHKUSH and DAN BILEFSKY
byline.contributor: Isma’il Kushkush reported from Nairobi, and Dan Bilefsky from London. Sadi Niyungeko contributed reporting from Bujumbura, Burundi; Somini Sengupta from the United Nations; and Jacey Fortin from Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.

lead_paragraph: Gunfire and explosions were heard in the capital a day after a general announced a takeover, but it was not clear who was in control of the central African country.

headline.main: Uncertainty Reigns in Burundi After Attempted Coup
headline.print_headline: Back in Burundi, President Calls for Calm

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
